Front yard is gated (and where you'll park). Back yard has bikes to use, a picnic table with a chandelier for night time gatherings and sun chairs. Access to garage with washer/dryer. Back yard is split into 2 sections (the back section has an Airstream on it--ask about availability). This compound is Venice living at it's finest The house is an updated classic Venice Beach bungalow with the most incredible back yard where you could potentially spend most of your time for relaxing, playing, and dining. Guests have access to the entire house and most of the large outside backyard with dinging table, fire pit and lounge chairs.  The airstream has a separate outside and fire pit area that may or may not be occupied at the time. If interested in the airstream availability please ask. Brianne has been an airbnb host for over 5 years

A full sized memory foam bed with down comforter, a separate kitchen with breakfast bar, desk and settee. And bathroom with large tub perfect for bubble baths. Bath towels and beach towels provided. Restaurants and shops on Rose and Abbot Kinney are a short walk away. You will have access to the whole apartment. I will also provide the key to my bike so that you don't have to rent one. The house is in a perfect location on a beautiful walk street, one block from the Venice Canals, and a short hop from Abbot Kinney. Relax in the garden fringed by papyrus, grab a lemon or lime from the fruit trees, ride one of the three colorful beach cruisers along the ocean to the farmer's market in Santa Monica, down to the fishing pier in Redondo Beach, or just pop over to one of the swank restruants or boutiques along Abbot Kinney. description: A large converted art loft studio with an open living space (675 square feet), vaulted wood ceilings, draped skylights, a new bathroom and a mini kitchen. Paint splattered floors contrast with modern furnishings. A project space which takes the format of a beach-side vacation as its overt, permanent backdrop. Originally a painter’s studio, then a vacation rental, now The Air Inn Venice, it uses multi-functional architecture and interior design as a way to rethink divisions between producer, product, spectator, and participant. Exhibition space, domestic idyll, stage set, office, discussion platform, business, curatorial frame, and leisure retreat, become entangled and held up for scrutiny through guests’ interventions and contributions. With a nod to art’s pre-modern uses, the autonomous, privileged position of the spectator melts in the LA sunshine. This is a large converted art studio with an open living space (675 square feet), vaulted wood ceilings, draped skylights, a new bathroom
name: THE AIR INN VENICE

description: Top 10 things a 'Venice Beach Cool' family need in a home? 1.  Biking distance to the beach 2.  Walking distance to an AMAZING park 3.  Modern kitchen a chef would be proud of 4. Outdoor playpen area stocked with toys 5. Toddler bed as well as a baby crib 6.  Beautiful salt water pool 7.  Professional gym with cardio and free weights 8.  Extremely safe area of Venice 9.  65 inch TV (to keep the kids occupied) 10. Best location in Venice! TOP 10 things to keep in mind when visiting Venice Beach... 1. Parking sucks! Especially in the summer! Make sure whatever accommodation you choose provides parking. 2. Venice has become incredibly trendy in the past few years. However, that also means incredibly expensive. Eating out, even a cup of coffee have become costly in our Village. 3. Buying stuff for your kids in Venice is a fortune. There are no Walmarts or Babies R Us.  Our baby/toddler retailers are very boutique oriented and costly. 4.   The Ocean is very cold here all year round.  Swimmi
name: Is your family 'Venice Beach Cool'?

description: I love my neighborhood. My apartment is a block away from the famous Venice boardwalk. It is steps away from restaurants, cafes, bars and of course the beach. I will be leaving you a key for that. There are so many things to do around Venice that is hard to specify the best ones. However I will give you a list of my favorite spots.  Coffee:  Groundworks - Amazing coffee, people and not too expensive. There is one on the boardwalk and one on Rose St.  Gjusta - My guilty pleasure, it is a bit expensive but they have the best "cortado" in LA. It is on Sunset Ave. and Hampton right across the Gold's Gym. Food: Fig Tree - Has great breakfast right on the boardwalk and good mimosas. Great place for people watching Venice Ale House - Amazing burgers and good quality beer.  Bars: Townhouse: An amazing speakea

description: Blackbird Cabin is unique, private oasis right in the heart of Venice. Hidden behind a 1913 ORIGINAL Venetian home, it's a 2 minute stroll to Abbot Kinney Blvd, one of the hottest streets in the world. You'll have your pick of restaurants, galleries, shops, coffee, bars & food trucks. Want the beach? Just 5 blocks to sun and surf! Bright, clean and contemporary home, completely redecorated and refurbished in Summer 2013 House comes with WiFi, Basic TV + HBO, Bose music dock, Canon printer. description: Location, location! This modern suite is a half block from the beach on the Marina Peninsula in Marina Del Rey. Situated in a safe, beautiful and quiet area, our 1 bedroom suite has its own private entrance and sits over a separate three car garage. It has hardwood floors, high ceilings, lots of light and a fully equipped kitchen with refrigerator, gas stove and microwave. The bedroom has a queen size bed, and the bathroom has marble flooring and shower equipped with rainwater shower head. You have access to one car covered parking in the garage, which is worth its weight in gold. Within a two minute walk you are at the intersection of the ocean and marina channel, a beautiful sight to sit and watch the boats go by. We are located 15 minutes from LAX, close to Washington Blvd. which has restaurants, bike and surf rentals, and a bike path along the beach. description: If you love the sun and the beach, this bright airy 2 bedroom 1 bathroom Spanish style bungalow is the perfect home away from home for you.    The house is situation in heart of Venice, walking distance to everything you will want to easily access. This home was built in the early 1920's and features mint colored walls and wood floors.  The Spanish styled arched window in front and as well as the arched wall separating the dining and living room are surrounded by windows and bathed in light.  These details combined with various antiques, and revolving works of art from local Venice artists, mixed with the shabby chic decor and modern highlights give this home a true eclectic Venice beach house feel.   I can only accept short term stays at the moment of 5 days or less.  Thank you! description: Fully remodeled in 2012, the Common Studio is beautifully designed to celebrate Southern California's easy-breezy lifestyle. Big French doors open the entire space to charming front yard. Feel the air and freshness when you chill outdoors, and indulge in comfort and peace when you stay in. Ideally located on a quiet upscale street in the center of Venice Beach community, our studio is just a few steps to Whole Foods Market and golf course, and a short bike ride to Abbot Kinney, Santa Monica Main Street, and Venice beach. When you arrive, enjoy a drought-tolerant garden with firepit, exposed wood truss ceilings, a functional kitchenette, a comfortable full-size bed plus a daybed, a big flat-screen TV, and Fios high speed WiFi. Small and well-behaved pets are welcome.  Spend your next L.A. retreat to the fullest in our studio! Come and explore the diverse and vibrant mix of So Cal cultures!
name: The Common Studio, Venice Beach, CA

We provide surf boards & beach chairs. Close to everything! Coffee shops, bars & restaurants. Widely regarded as the best 1 bd cottage in Venice. Our glorious little slice of heaven is a quintessential Venice Beach Cottage, built in 1907 and lovingly restored by “Restoration Bliss,” a century later in 2007.  Located on a quiet alley in the heart of hipster Venice, we are only a minute’s walk from the funky Venice Boardwalk, paddle tennis courts, & famous Muscle Beach, where the sand, ocean and excellent breakwater surfbreak are right there ready for you to unwind and do your thing. description: Right at the footsteps of Abbot Kinney and three blocks from the ocean, this tranquil and sunny California craftsman 3-bedroom bungalow is the perfect Venice stay! You have the chance to live like a local Venetian, stepping out to high-end restaurants and boutiques, or stay in this secluded house in a private location right around the corner from Abbot Kinney. This historic craftsman bungalow built in 1914 includes a private parking for one car, private deck, a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms with queen-sized beds, full sofa in the living room and a full futon sofa in the beautiful, cozy sunroom. Washer/dryer also on the premises.  High-speed Wifi and Cable TV. This house is friendly to families and pets. Guests have access to the entire property. description: Welcome to Venice Beach California! Home of sun, sand and a hip cool vibe that only Venice can offer. My place is located on a charming walk-street steps from the sand with ocean views from the balcony. The decor is charming, cozy and trendy.  Walk or bike to some of LA's hippest restaurants, coffee shops & bars. Venice Beach hot spots at Abbot Kinney, Main and Rose Streets are all just minutes away. You can also stock up on wholesome essentials at the neighborhood Whole Foods Market. There is a public parking lot about 1 block away that is free from 6pm to 9am. There is also street parking. I would suggest Ubering or biking as most places are within walking distance. The train is located in Santa Monica and is about a 10 minute drive away. There is 1 bicycle for you to borrow and plenty of bike rental shops within walking distance. My bike must be locked at all times and stored inside of the apartment. If the bike is damaged or stolen the full security deposit will be taken.
name: Charming Venice Apartment

The home opens with a unique Dutch door, inviting you to enter and enjoy the wood furnishings and fireplace. Next to the kitchen, which hosts a generous double oven and dining table, the leather sofas and a textured rug create a comfortable seating area.  Want to enjoy the LA sun? Walk through the sliding doors and you will find a grilling and patio area that will be a perfect spot to enjoy the garden.  The master bedroom of this home hosts a playful wooden sleigh bed, patterned ottoman and its own terrace. The double rooms upstairs are soothing – in one the bed sits above a a fluffy sheepskin rug, and the other is host to engaging modern art. description: This one bedroom, one bathroom Venice apartment is in a residential section of the beachside city. The Space This one bedroom, one bathroom Venice apartment is in a residential section of the beachside city.  The Neighborhood  A seaside resort town, Venice is known for its sunny beaches, canals, and boardwalks! It's a great family-friendly destination any time of year. There are plenty of unique shops and restaurants to check out, and everyone should make a pit stop in Marina Del Rey too.  Getting Around  Venice is filled with walkable streets, but public transportation is also available. If you have a car, the major expressways are nearby and easily accessible to this apartment. Downtown LA is 40 minutes west of Venice.  Other Things to Note  Come stay in this one bedroom Venice apartment!  Please remember that you will be staying in a home, not a hotel. description: Single family house in Venice Beach "Silver Triangle". 3 queen sized beds and sleeps 6 comfortably. Original beach bungalow exterior and ultra modern interior. Situated in the cozy and super exclusive 'Silver Triangle' neighborhood of Venice Beach, just behind the historic Venice Canals, is this three bedroom two bath home. Completely remodeled to impeccable standards and a brand new 'chefs kitchen' featuring a 6 burner Wolf range with a 36 inch gas oven, a Wolf 30 inch electric wall oven, Wolf microwave, dishwasher and a Sub-Zero refrigerator. A short walk to Abbot Kinney and the amazing shops and restaurants in one direction and the other direction are the famous Venice Canals built around 1910 by Abbot Kinney. Just past the canals is the popular boardwalk of Venice Beach with all its charm of the small shops, street vendors and performers and of course Muscle Beach. LAX is 15 minutes away and $35 by taxi. Marina Del Rey is just on the south side of Washington Blvd or a 5 minute walk
name: Venice Beach House 3-bed 2-bath Silver Triangle

description: My place is close to Venice Beach, Abott Kinney and Main St. 5 min from Santa Monica, and walking distance to the best shops and restaurants in all of Venice. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the outdoors space, the neighborhood, and the Venice "feel" it has. Common area in the back which is great to hang and relax. There is also a washer/dryer available there, too. There is parking on the street! The cottage has a YELLOW door- can't miss it! Checkin: 4pm Checkout: 11am Hardwood floors, colorful rooms, and located in the heart of Venice. 2 BR /1 Bath, with a couch to crash on in the Living Room as well. It's a characteristic Venice pad and the price is unbeatable! You will have access to the entire home :) You'll have access to park on the street. The entire property is fenced/gated, providing an extra level of comfort and security during your stay. Auto-generated codes let you in to your unit's front door. description: Steps from the beach and walking distance to Abbot Kinney (Venice) and Main Street (Santa Monica), you couldn't find a better location for your getaway. Enjoy the waves, sand, and famous Venice beach boardwalk just steps from your front door. Your own cozy studio on the Beach! While this is perfect for a couple (or single person), you could easily accommodate more (very comfy couch to sleep on). Steps from the Venice boardwalk and the beach, there is so much to do and see in Venice and the surrounding areas. Besides having the beach in your backyard, you will be a block from Abbot Kinney Boulevard, which was voted by GQ Magazine last year as the “coolest block in America.” It is lined with amazing restaurants, great bars, art galleries and tons of unique/cool shops. A half a mile walk down the boardwalk is Main Street, another street of fantastic/diverse restaurants, bars and shops.  And it doesn't stop there, you are also walking distance from Rose Ave, which is blossoming into one of
name: Steps from the Beach! Venice Livin'

description: Breathtakingly beautiful contemporary home with floor to ceiling glass sliding doors that open like a pavilion onto a lush and tranquil garden, complete with fountain, covered patio and endless sun. Luxury, tranquility, and a minimalist aesthetic permeates this recently completed home, designed by the owner/architect. An open rectangular plan defines the ground level, which passes onto green garden foliage and a fountain through floor-to-ceiling glass windows and sliders.  The house sits like a pavilion within the garden, the actual walls of the house becoming the perimeter hedges, trees, and borrowed views beyond.     Bedroom 1 includes a California King pillow top mattress, high thread count linens, custom cabinetry, washer/dryer, and a 9 foot sliding glass wall opening on to a covered outdoor 'living room' and garden. Bedroom 2, if desired, is a bonus space off the hallway which closes off with a curtain (as does Bedroom 1) to create an additional sleeping area for up to two people.
name: Contemporary Architectural Dream

description: Our newly renovated gem is walking distance to Venice beach, Boardwalk, Abbot Kinney, Venice Canals and  Marina Del Rey.  The bungalow is detached with it's own entrance and a small private patio. This place feels like a home away from home. Welcome to our Little Red Bungalow!! A cozy relaxing place where you rejuvenate, read a book, or enjoy a drink on the patio. Our place is newly renovated with vaulted ceilings, skylight and heated bathroom floor. Private entrance through a wooden gate leads you into your own little patio and bungalow. We live in the main house and will respect your privacy. However, we are happy to answer questions and give recommendations. Upon request, pick up and drop off from LAX is available for a fee. We love our neighborhood! Venice Beach and the Boardwalk are 15-20 min walk/5-10 min bike ride away. We have amazing restaurants from cool local breakfast/lunch places to hip, trendy and organic restaurants and local bars all within 0-2miles. You can view the su
name: The Red Venice Bungalow

description: Well appointed 2 bedroom apartment located on Venice Blvd.  Master bedroom w/ Queen bed, Guest room with King Sized  Mattress. Walkable to restaurants, bars, and markets. 5 miles from LAX, 1.5 Miles to Venice Beach, 3.7 Miles to Santa Monica Pier. Beautifully adorned with luxury furniture, flat screen TV, fireplace, and outfitted kitchen. Smoking allowed on balcony with charcoal barbecue. Includes 2 covered, gated garage parking spaces. Four post queen bed in the master bedroom, king sized air mattress in the guest bedroom. Unit is on the first floor of an apartment building on Venice near Glencoe. However, because there is a garage underneath, the unit is on the "second" floor in the back of the building, so there is little to no road noise, and the balcony is rather private (except for the neighbor's balcony that is adjacent - separated by about 25 feet). Elevator is also available in the building. The entire unit is available for guest access. Guests will be greeted and shown around
name: 2 Bedroom Apt Venice Near Beach

description: Bright, airy home on beautiful, quiet, tree-lined street in Venice. Shops and restaurants just down the block, famed Abbott Kinney Blvd. six blocks away through historic walk streets. It's a 5-minute bike ride (bikes available) to the beach. Large deck and garden area with both a gas and a charcoal barbecue are great for dining outdoors. The main house, grounds, gardens, and deck are yours for the duration of your stay. Our guest house is unavailable at this time. We'll most likely be welcoming you, but if not, you'll be surrounded by lots of friends and neighbors who will hand you the keys, navigate you through the house, the grounds, and the streets of Venice, and be close by should you need help with anything. Ours is a safe, quiet and friendly neighborhood with on-street parking available. Be sure to check our guidebook of personal faves for local sights and scenes. Great restaurants, a bakery, a major grocery chain store, and Whole Foods are walk-able. Just down the block you can

description: My place is a 2bdrm/2bath apartment on the 2nd floor of a 4 unit building, which is just half a block from the boardwalk, beach, windward circle, skatepark and muscle beach!! 10 minute walk to the Venice Pier!  The neighborhood is very lively with lots going on all of the time. If you are very sensitive to noise, this neighborhood is not ideal. This is an extremely centrally located place right in the middle of everything Venice has to offer. I am open to discussing pets staying. My building is from the 70's, and much of the interior is still vintage please keep in mind that just because the floors, counters, sink, tubs etc might have permanent markings, this does not mean it is dirty or hasn't been cleaned. I assure you that my place is scrubbed and disinfected between each guest, it's just part of the character of my place :) My place is not the Ritz Carlton, it is in an older building.. but if you've always wanted to have the full Venice Beach experience, this is perfect for you! EV
name: 1/2 Block from Beach...2BR/2BATH Apartment
